page.title: 13The Village School
page.content: Bowes(Hutchinson's Endowed)Church of England Primary School's roll has fallen dramatically in the last 5 years and could in the future be threatened with closure without an influx of young children into the catchment area.Mickleton and Eggleston schools have already closed.An ageing population,later marriage and a trend towards smaller families all contribute to this decline in numbers.Any amalgamation with other schools would increase the travel necessary by young children some of whom already live 4 or more miles from school. A possible solution may be the creation of a Federation of Primary Schools to share staffing and resources.Education is under threat in the area because of declining population and inflation. Perhaps a Community College would solve this.
